 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לֻא‎</span> [[2Sam.18.12|2Sam 18:12]] [[BDB#Kt|Kt]] ([[BDB#Qr|Qr]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לוּ‎</span>) if: see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לוּ‎</span>. 

 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לוּ‎</span><sub>17</sub> and <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לוּא‎</span> ( [[1Sam.14.30|1Sam 14:30]]; [[Isa.48.18|Isa 48:18]]; [[Isa.63.19|Isa 63:19]]), also <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לֻא‎</span> ([[BDB#Qr|Qr]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לוּ‎</span>), [[2Sam.18.12|2Sam 18:12]]; [[2Sam.19.7|2Sam 19:7]] (Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, Aramaic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְוַי‎</span>, Mishna <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְוַי‎</span>, Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***lû***</u></abbr>, with optative force, [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>§§ 78 end, 93, 145</sup>; compare [[BDB#Kö|Kö]]<sup>ii. 333</sup>), **conjunction** ==if, O that==: — 

**1.** ***if*** (stating a case which has not been, or is not likely to be, realized): 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** followed by perfect (so mostly), [[Deut.32.29|Deut 32:29]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לו חכמו ישׂכילו זאת‎</span> ***if*** they had been wise (which they are not), they would understand this; [[Mic.2.11|Mic 2:11]] (apodosis <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְהָיָה‎</span>); [[Judg.8.19|Judg 8:19]]; [[Judg.13.23|Judg 13:23]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎להמיתנו לא לקח לו‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חפץ י‎</span> ***if*** J. had desired to slay us, he would not have taken, &amp;c.; [[1Sam.14.30|1Sam 14:30]]; [[2Sam.19.7|2Sam 19:7]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** followed by imperfect [[Ezek.14.15|Ezek 14:15]] ***if*** I were to send, &amp;c. (but read probably <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אוֺ‎</span>, compare v[[Ezek.14.17|Ezek 14:17]] v[[Ezek.14.19|Ezek 14:19]]). 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **c.** followed by participle, [[2Sam.18.12|2Sam 18:12]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְלֻא אָנֹכִי שֹׁקֵל‎</span> and ***though*** I should be weighing 1000 pieces of silver upon my hand, I would not, &amp;c.; [[Ps.81.14|Ps 81:14]]-17 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לו עמי שֹׁמֵעַ לי‎</span> ***if*** my people were hearkening to me, . . . quickly would I bow down, &amp;c. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **d.** followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יֵשׁ‎</span> [[Job.16.4|Job 16:4]]. — With the apodosis omitted, [[Gen.50.15|Gen 50:15]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לוּ יִשְׂטְמֵנוּ‎</span> ***if*** Joseph were to hate us (how should we fare then ?).


**2.** ***If only ...!*** i.e. ***O that! would that!*** (compare <span class="bdbLangGreek">εἰ γάρ</span>, <span class="bdbLangGreek">εἴθε</span>) usually followed by perf., as [[Num.14.2|Num 14:2]] (twice in verse) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לוּ מַתְנוּ‎</span> ***if only*** we had died in the land of Egypt! [[Num.20.3|Num 20:3]]; [[Josh.7.7|Josh 7:7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְלוּ הוֺאַלְנוּ וַנֵּשֶׁב‎</span> [[Isa.48.18|Isa 48:18]]; [[Isa.63.19|Isa 63:19]] followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יֵשׁ‎</span> [[Num.22.29|Num 22:29]] followed by imperfect [[Gen.17.18|Gen 17:18]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לו יחיה‎</span> ***O that*** Ishmael might live before thee! [[Job.6.2|Job 6:2]] followed by jussive [[Gen.30.34|Gen 30:34]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כדברך לו יהי‎</span>; followed by imperative [[Gen.23.13|Gen 23:13]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אם אתה לוּ שׁמעני‎</span> if thou — ***O that*** thou wouldst hear me! (+ probably v[[Gen.23.5|Gen 23:5]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לאמר ׃ לוּ שׁמעני‎</span> for <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לאמרֹ לוֺ ׃ שׁ‎</span>, and similarly v[[Gen.23.15|Gen 23:15]]). — Read also probably <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לֻא‎</span> for Masoretic <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לֹא‎</span> [[Judg.21.22|Judg 21:22]] (with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כִּי עַתָּה‎</span>), [[1Sam.13.13|1Sam 13:13]]; [[1Sam.20.14|1Sam 20:14]] (twice in verse); [[Job.9.33|Job 9:33]] (followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יֵשׁ‎</span>); and perhaps [[Job.14.4|Job 14:4]] ([[BDB#Ew|Ew]] [[BDB#Kö|Kö]]).
